channel.title: TheCyberMan-Galaxy 317 ~Best Allstar Ever Made~
channel.description:
Hello,
I had, for a few months, familiarized myself with some basic Java when coding this. I now know how to make a lot for this Allstar base. I simply wish for your input on what thing/things I should add before I quit making my RSPS. My info on the server is here:
[url=http://www.thecyberman.com/galaxy/features.html]TheCyberMan-Galaxy[/url]
What do you guys think? Is it worth developing more (even though I already stopped for 3 months)?
TheCyberMan
EDIT:
I have had difficulty keeping my 317 server hosting on my MacBook without shutting down in an hour (if even that lucky). For a couple months, a person with a horrible Windows XP Desktop, that had about 4 GB Harddrive space left, hosted it. Even that caused shut downs after a few hours; though, that was expected.
I have a splendid Macintosh Desktop with 2.26Ghz, 4 GB Ram, and 1.07 Ghz Bus Speed (it needs to be upgraded to Snow Leopard to even host, so I have not tested it yet). I am willing to host a server 24/7 but this is where I need your help...how do I keep it running? If it's a desktop, does it tend to run more hours than a laptop? Assuming it won't continuously run, do any of you have a Terminal shell file that reboots my type of server every few hours like a "voule.bat?" Do you have advice or methods to keep it running?
Thank You!
P.S. There is so much info that I ran past the character limit when I tried putting my server information here. I mean no advertising whatsoever.

item.title: TheCyberMan-Galaxy 317 ~Best Allstar Ever Made~
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:14, topic:387819”]Thank you

That is exactly my second main reason why I stayed with an Allstar base! It can be very flexible realistically (like Runescape) or creatively (experiments with coding)! The same applies with Delta, but Delta is more popular and updated organizationally. Though since I had gone so far into my Allstar base, by the time I found out Delta is a comparable source that’s more popular, I didn’t want switch since I made so much. Honestly though, do you think all that I did could be done as easily with a PI source (I’m not saying that all I did was easy)? That source scares me a bit because it’s so different.[/quote]

LMAO LMAO LMAO this is actually the first paragraph. You know, sorta when you start reading how it’s like…the first paragraph? lol? It was in response to the person above my comment, so I put what he was talking about first, then I went on to my other reasons.

Don’t lower my rep please. That was just funny

Read full topic

item.title: TheCyberMan-Galaxy 317 ~Best Allstar Ever Made~
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

m1lkman:

Read the first paragraph…

I did. He says

The First main reason I chose an Allstar base was because I had no other choice. ROFL. I’m on a Mac and Allstar-bases are the only 317 sources that work on Mac.

The Third main reason I stayed with Allstar was because I noticed people abandoned it…It had potential, but since Delta made such a great source, developers probably wanted the best base for a 317 at the time. At the time when I finally found out that Allstar was practically despised by the community and there were so many better sources, I almost quit coding TheCyberMan-Galaxy. I just kept the thought that I would create the best Allstar base out there and possibly design my own source (I’d call it something like Project-Galaxy, but I’m not there yet because I stopped coding for awhile).

First reason is because he has no choice but to use All-star being on a mac. Third reason is because all-star has potential but people abandoned it. What’s the second.

Read full topic

item.title: TheCyberMan-Galaxy 317 ~Best Allstar Ever Made~
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:14, topic:387819”]Thank you

That is exactly my second main reason why I stayed with an Allstar base! It can be very flexible realistically (like Runescape) or creatively (experiments with coding)! The same applies with Delta, but Delta is more popular and updated organizationally. Though since I had gone so far into my Allstar base, by the time I found out Delta is a comparable source that’s more popular, I didn’t want switch since I made so much. Honestly though, do you think all that I did could be done as easily with a PI source (I’m not saying that all I did was easy)? That source scares me a bit because it’s so different.

The First main reason I chose an Allstar base was because I had no other choice. ROFL. I’m on a Mac and Allstar-bases are the only 317 sources that work on Mac.

The Third main reason I stayed with Allstar was because I noticed people abandoned it…It had potential, but since Delta made such a great source, developers probably wanted the best base for a 317 at the time. At the time when I finally found out that Allstar was practically despised by the community and there were so many better sources, I almost quit coding TheCyberMan-Galaxy. I just kept the thought that I would create the best Allstar base out there and possibly design my own source (I’d call it something like Project-Galaxy, but I’m not there yet because I stopped coding for awhile).

P.S. It’s late right now and I’m tired. What I wrote above probably doesn’t make sense, lol :P[/quote]
What’s the second main reason :o

Read full topic

item.title: TheCyberMan-Galaxy 317 ~Best Allstar Ever Made~
item.dc:creator: @TheCyberMan TheCyberMan
item.description:
@TheCyberMan wrote:

Thank you

That is exactly my second main reason why I stayed with an Allstar base! It can be very flexible realistically (like Runescape) or creatively (experiments with coding)! The same applies with Delta, but Delta is more popular and updated organizationally. Though since I had gone so far into my Allstar base, by the time I found out Delta is a comparable source that’s more popular, I didn’t want switch since I made so much. Honestly though, do you think all that I did could be done as easily with a PI source (I’m not saying that all I did was easy)? That source scares me a bit because it’s so different.

The First main reason I chose an Allstar base was because I had no other choice. ROFL. I’m on a Mac and Allstar-bases are the only 317 sources that work on Mac.

The Third main reason I stayed with Allstar was because I noticed people abandoned it…It had potential, but since Delta made such a great source, developers probably wanted the best base for a 317 at the time. At the time when I finally found out that Allstar was practically despised by the community and there were so many better sources, I almost quit coding TheCyberMan-Galaxy. I just kept the thought that I would create the best Allstar base out there and possibly design my own source (I’d call it something like Project-Galaxy, but I’m not there yet because I stopped coding for awhile).

P.S. It’s late right now and I’m tired. What I wrote above probably doesn’t make sense, lol

Read full topic

item.title: TheCyberMan-Galaxy 317 ~Best Allstar Ever Made~
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

If it’s pretty much all created by you, you have a lot of good ideas and a creative mind. Keep it up.

noobs are ftw:

uhhhh no there is no good allstar servers but at least ur trying

Are you kidding me? Talking in efficiency and how well wL is programmed, no. Talking in the amount of fun and creativity, Czar/Allstar was the second highest peak for me after the first servers like Cheezescape 80. I can play a PI-based server for a few days before I’m about to die of boredom.

Read full topic

There may be close to no pictures of mine, but when you read what I did and truly imagine all the work put into it…it changes your perspective.
